body: @guatomallin can you try installing 2.2.1.rc1  by running in your conda env `pip install deeplabcut==2.2.1rc1`? I believe this function was updated (released quitely last night :) so happy for the beta feedback too

Hi @MMathisLab!  I updated and ran the triangulation call with filtered predictions on a folder with few pairs of videos. The function analyzed all videos, but it repeatedly triangulated one of the pairs only. I pasted the output below. The call triangulates single pairs just fine. The triangulation call without filtered predictions is still having the same problem. 

This is the ouput: 

I then ran deeplabcut.create_labeled_video_3d(r'D:\project_deeplabcut\RD_2CAM-CP-2022-03-31-3d\config.yaml', [r'D:\project_deeplabcut\3DVideo'] ) with the following error: 

```bash
`File ~\anaconda3\envs\DEEPLABCUT\lib\site-packages\deeplabcut\pose_estimation_3d\plotting3D.py:197, in create_labeled_video_3d(config, path, videofolder, start, end, trailpoints, videotype, view, xlim, ylim, zlim, draw_skeleton, color_by, figsize, fps, dpi)
    194 try:
    195     print("Looking for filtered predictions...")
    196     df_cam1 = pd.read_hdf(
--> 197         glob.glob(

    199                 path_h5_file,

    201                     "*" + base_filename_cam1 + cam1_scorer + "*filtered.h5"
    202                 ),

    204         )[0]
    205     )
    206     df_cam2 = pd.read_hdf(
    207         glob.glob(
    208             os.path.join(
   (...)

    216     # print("Found filtered predictions, will be use these for triangulation.")
```
IndexError: list index out of range`

I suspect the issue is in my config file though I can't spot the problem. I'm still using the same config file I posted here. 

Thanks again!

indeed the not looping looks like and issue (cc @jeylau), but for `deeplabcut.create_labeled_video_3d` that can't take a folder, it should take a single pair; it's otherwise very slow (and just meant to make short videos for checking), and requires a skeleton, etc.
